comments.text:
is private ownership of guns restricted in England to only one or two 
weapons. ﻿
comments.author: Sean Collins

comments.text:
+Herb Semi automatic weapons are legal but you can't have anything larger 
than .22lr. You can own any bolt action rifle or straight pull rifle. No 
handguns though, except what UK law calls "long barreled handguns" which 
are basically carbines. Even the police only have 9mm MP5s restricted to 
semi auto and glock 17s, they are trying to get 5.56 carbines like the LMT 
one that the army uses though.
+Nick Lee That would be a straight pull modified aug. You have to cock it 
after every shot.
comments.author: Sam Lemke

comments.text: i saw an aug for sale on a uk gun website before.

comments.text:
France has very restrictive gun laws as well.  But I heard that if one does 
have a gun they have to keep it disassembled if they are not at a shooting 
range or their own home.
comments.author: Stephan Vaudiau

comments.text:
The guns Angel got were confiscated from a farmer who found them over the 
course of years.  As for the others in Sanford the chief of police is part 
of their conspiracy.  I am sure he could acquire guns for them.
comments.author: Stephan Vaudiau

comments.text:
Although there is some regulation that you can get any gun you want, you 
just need a very, VERY, valid reason
comments.author: asdfboochica

comments.text:
It's almost impossible to get a gun in England. The occasional farmer, 
hunter or competitive marksman may have a rifle. Anything semi to fully 
automatic is unheard of.
